string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

search.slidetext: in this course, you will build confidence with your finances and gain a feeling of control over your money: how to earn, spend, borrow, and save money confidently. welcome! financial literacy 5 minutes learn how to navigate this course! go! go! go!
15 minutes banking learn to earn financial literacy go! go! go!
explain how to open a bank account. objective 03 03 identify the purpose of banks. objective 02 02 name 2 sources of income. objective 01 01 objectives earning
tap here to type in the code go! go! go! earning pre-test how much do you know? complete the pre-test to unlock the code. then tap go! to continue.

what is earning? you can receive your income in different ways: in cash, on a check, or on a card. 03 when you earn money, the money that you take home is called your income. 02 earning money is when you receive money from working at a job or from government assistance programs. 01 earning
sources of income earning help asha decide if this is a source of income by tapping yes or no: no no no yes yes yes start! start! start! 0/6

income is money you take home. there are many sources of income you may have. you may be paid in cash, by check or receive money on a government-issued card such as wic, snap, or tanf. lottery tickets, coupons and credit cards are not sources of income. earning sources of income go! go! go!

how much do you already know about banks? banking i don’t know much about banks. i don’t know much about banks. i don’t know much about banks. i don’t know much about banks. i don’t know much about banks. i don’t know much about banks. i already know about banks i already know about banks i already know about banks i already know about banks i already know about banks i already know about banks earning

a bank is an organization that keeps the money you give to the bank in an account. the bank uses your money to make investments that they can earn money on. what is a bank? earning visual animation of banking concepts here.
what’s the difference? credit unions protect your money protection cash and write checks checking

this is the fourth way that my coworker could respond to me. d this is the third way that my coworker could respond to me. c this is the second way that my coworker could respond to me. b this is one possible way that my coworker could respond to me. choose my response by clicking an item below. i’m making a comment. how should my coworker respond to me? a true/false questions here (coming soon)
15 minutes to find free tax preparation continue continue continue paychecks learn to earn financial literacy
identify when and where to go for free tax preparation. objective 03 03 define taxes. objective 02 02 analyze a paycheck. objective 01 01 objectives earning

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

terms.term: A plastic card from a government program that has a certain amount of money that you can spend by swiping or inserting it in machines at a store. Example: SNAP, WIC, TANF (see also: credit card)
Paper or coin money (different from checks or cards)
A paper document that you sign that tells the bank to allow a person or company to take money from your bank account.
To receive money from working at a job or from government assistance programs (to make money).
Money that you take home from working at a job or from government assistance programs.
